title: (x) Bookey Consulting Inc. italic serif - Georgia {Dav, Lex}
content:
I can’t pick it out, parts of it look like a Bookman, but that’s not it...or maybe there’s a variation beyond the basic four that I have?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [bookey.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080605213750/http:/typophile.com/files/bookey.jpg) | 36.74 KB |

 [‹ (x) Puma's World Cup uniforms font - custom font by Dalton-Maag {Tiff}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080605213750/http:/www.typophile.com/node/20681 "Go to previous forum topic") [Binder Park Zoo Type ID ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080605213750/http:/www.typophile.com/node/20678 "Go to next forum topic")
author: dunnyman

comments.content:
The ’k’ looks like either ITC Bookman or Bookman Old Style, but the ’y’ looks more like ITC CLearface, with the curled serif. The rest of your sample looks like one of those Bookman versions to me.

- Mike Yanega

[’Georgia’](http://web.archive.org/web/20080605213750/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ascender/georgia/).

Why so it is (my face is red). Good work Dav & Lex.

- Mike Yanega

Why is it that nobody posts for over an hour, then we get a triple-cross-post?

- Lex

My ’excuse’ would be that I just ’checked in’, on Typophile, prior to posting my reply. :)

[Dav](http://web.archive.org/web/20080605213750/http:/www.dav.name/)

That would be my excuse as well, but it’s strange that we all “checked in” at the same time.

- Lex
